info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 16 at 1:04AM MST by NWS Flagstaff AZ
info.description:
At 104 AM MST, Doppler radar was tracking an area of strong thunderstorms extending from 8 miles northwest of Hyde Creek Mountain to 7 miles south of Upper Burro Creek Wilderness, or extending from 32 miles west of Chino Valley to 49 miles west of Prescott, moving north at 30 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects.
Locations impacted include... Hyde Creek Mountain, Mohon Peak, Denny Mountain, Upper Burro Creek Wilderness, Bagdad Airport, Bagdad, Mount Hope, Apache Creek Wilderness, Juniper Mesa Wilderness, Walnut Creek Ranger Station and Cross Mountain.
This includes the following highways... Highway 93 between mile markers 149 and 151. State Route 96 between mile markers 0 and 5. State Route 97 between mile markers 160 and 166.
info.instruction:
Monitor the weather situation closely and be alert for threatening weather conditions.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

parameter.value: AN AREA OF STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT YAVAPAI COUNTY UNTIL 2 AM MST

area.areaDesc: Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins
